22 Orang Tewas dalam Kecelakaan Truk di Kongo
01 Nov 2019, 22:30 by , https://www.facebook.com/CNNIndonesia


Ilustrasi kecelakaan. (Istockphoto/razerbird)

Jakarta, CNN Indonesia -- Sedikitnya 22 orang tewas dan 10 lainnya luka-luka ketika sebuah truk tambang terbalik di Kongo tenggara, Jumat (1/11). Polisi setempat mengatakan jumlah korban yang besar tersebut terjadi karena truk mengangkut banyak penumpang ketika terbalik di desa Mutetenya di Provinsi Tanganyika.Truk tersebut dimiliki oleh Mining Mineral Resources (MMR), sebuah perusahaan India yang terdaftar di Tanzania."Semua muatan cassiterite (sumber mineral timah) tumpah di lereng curam," katanya seperti dikutip dari AFP, Jumat (1/11). Sementara itu Pierre Mukamba, administrator wilayah Manono mengatakan sebelum kecelakaan terjadi, truk menabrak batu besar.Kecelakaan lalu lintas mematikan memang sering terjadi di negara Afrika tengah. Kecelakaan tersebut banyak dipicu kondisi jalan di daerah tersebut yang masih berupa tanah dan kurang terawat dengan baik. Di daerah tersebut, banyak orang tidak punya mobil. Selain itu, tidak ada transportasi umum yang menunjang kegiatan masyarakat.Akibatnya banyak orang naik truk pengangkut jarak jauh dalam kondisi yang sering berisiko. (AFP/agt)

22 killed in truck accident in Congo
01 Nov 2019, 22:30 by, https://www.facebook.com/CNNIndonesia


Illustration of an accident. (Istockphoto / razerbird)

Jakarta, Indonesian CNN - At least 22 people were killed and 10 injured when a mining truck overturned in southeastern Congo on Friday (1/11). Local police said the large number of casualties occurred due to trucks carrying many passengers when overturned in the village of Mutetenya in Tanganyika Province. The truck is owned by Mining Mineral Resources (MMR), an Indian company registered in Tanzania. ) spilled on steep slopes, "he said as quoted by AFP on Friday (1/11). Meanwhile Pierre Mukamba, administrator of the Manono region, said that before the accident occurred, trucks crashed into a large rock. Deadly traffic accidents do occur frequently in the central African country. The accident was mostly triggered by road conditions in the area which are still in the form of land and are poorly maintained. In that area, many people don't have cars. In addition, there is no public transportation that supports community activities. As a result, many people ride long-haul trucks in conditions that are often at risk. (AFP / Aug)
